alert.note: Alert for Brown (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 08 at 8:11PM EDT until June 09 at 1:00AM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1115 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of Northern Kentucky and Ohio, including the following counties, in Northern Kentucky, Campbell and Pendleton. In Ohio, Adams, Brown and Clermont. * WHEN...Until 1115 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 811 PM EDT, radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 1.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Some locations that may experience flooding include... Alexandria, Georgetown, Claryville, Amelia, Mount Orab, West Union, Bethel, New Richmond, Peebles, Silver Grove, Winchester, Sardinia, Seaman, Felicity, Melbourne, Higginsport, Neville, Cold Spring, Emerald and Blue Creek.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. To report flooding, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
